text: Map showing the Kibali River within the Ubangi River drainage basin The Kibali River is a tributary to the Uele River in the Democratic Republic of the Congo. It originates in the mountains near Lake Albert and flows west for about to join the Dungu River at Dungu where the Uele River is formed. The Uele is a tributary to the Ubangi River, which subsequently flows into the great Congo River. Category:Rivers of the Democratic Republic of the Congo
title: Kibali River
